Articles.Content: Very nice, I had worried that female Kerbals would look odd, but they don't, they look like they've been here forever.
The arms are strange... XD
Strange Arms. That must be soothing.
Valentina? Hey, i got that reference!

> 
> The arms are strange... XD

Folding your arms in a space suit will look different ... ^^

> 
> Folding your arms in a space suit will look different ... ^^

Not sure there has been a space suit in operation where you can actually fold your arms (don't count 1960's Lost in Space aluminised jump suits which looked quite suggestive on June Lockhart by the way... but I digress...) 

Hey, its a cartoon character, so...

> 
> Not sure there has been a space suit in operation where you can actually fold your arms (don't count 1960's Lost in Space aluminised jump suits which looked quite suggestive on June Lockhart by the way... but I digress...) 
> Hey, its a cartoon character, so...

Take a look at the original Mercury and Gemini space suits. Here is a link to an image of the original [Mercury 7 astronauts](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5a/Project_Mercury_Astronauts_-_GPN-2000-000651.jpg) 

You can see that those suits (which were really just jet pilot suits with aluminum put on the outside for looks) will allow them to do that.

I would agree about the modern suits.

> 
> Take a look at the original Mercury and Gemini space suits. Here is a link to an image of the original [Mercury 7 astronauts](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5a/Project_Mercury_Astronauts_-_GPN-2000-000651.jpg) 
> You can see that those suits (which were really just jet pilot suits with aluminum put on the outside for looks) will allow them to do that.
> 
> I would agree about the modern suits.

Yup, Fair enough. But I still think they (Real Mercury 7) would be quite uncomfortable fully crossing their arms for any pose like what is presented - even if they could do it.

But in the end I say... CARTOON! So anything is possible. Really. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I guess it depends on the material and thickness of the suit?

And also we all do it a bit differently. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

[https://www.google.de/search?q=crossed+arms&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=L5HsVOi-EIO4UZzpg4AO&ved=0CCIQsAQ&biw=1093&bih=885](https://www.google.de/search?q=crossed+arms&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=L5HsVOi-EIO4UZzpg4AO&ved=0CCIQsAQ&biw=1093&bih=885)

I posit that Kerbals still don't have lashes. Valentia is wearing eyeliner--and I am envious of those little wings on hers.

More seriously, great work!
Looks awesome!

no but seriously, thanks for not sexualizing the model, squad. every dev update the last month has been a much-needed banger.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-26T01:57:12Z" title="02/26/2015 01:57  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 26, 2015</time> by Vanamonde**

Ooooooh, very happy. So worried that it was gonna be over done for the sake of visual identification (As a game design student I understand the importance of it, and was willing to overlook if it came to it) but it's very well done here. Practical with a feminine touch. I look forward to her showing Jeb up. :3
Well, she looks a WHOLE lot better than what I was fretting about (saw all the attempts to add female textures to stock bodies/heads....\*shudders\*)
Hope altering a save to make a certain Kerbal female is possible/relatively easy. "Annie Kerman" has been female in my imagination since I recruited him/her.
This is reminding me more and more of bad 80's cartoons.

Kerbals don't have eyelids, but she has eyelashes.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> [https://www.google.de/search?q=crossed+arms&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=L5HsVOi-EIO4UZzpg4AO&ved=0CCIQsAQ&biw=1093&bih=885](https://www.google.de/search?q=crossed+arms&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=L5HsVOi-EIO4UZzpg4AO&ved=0CCIQsAQ&biw=1093&bih=885)

One of my friends walked by as I was looking at that link. He wanted to know why I was looking at pictures of people crossing their arms. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-27T21:35:14Z" title="02/27/2015 09:35  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 27, 2015</time> by Engineer Of Stuff**
  
Dat grammar

> 
> Kerbals don't have eyelids, but she has eyelashes.
> - - - Updated - - -

Ok, now I want a mod that makes them randomly blink.

Hadn't really thought about it much, but now, blast you, it's something missing! ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Seriously, I wish I could code, because I would do it if I could!

> 
> Ooooooh, very happy. So worried that it was gonna be over done for the sake of visual identification (As a game design student I understand the importance of it, and was willing to overlook if it came to it) but it's very well done here. Practical with a feminine touch. I look forward to her showing Jeb up. :3

And yeah, great job of making a female equal to the original three. I too, feared what might of come to pass.

Don't ruin my signature!
A discussion elsewhere about this suggested that, if Valentina had a name formed as Russian ones typically are, she would be "Valentina Kirrimovna Kermana". Apropos of nothing much.
I'm waiting for the scene where she makes Jeb pull the ship over to ask for directions.
Great
Great.. Jeb, You may want to run. The women are going to run you over.

Here's a leaked photo I found of Valentina on EVA.

![puRNrux.jpg](http://imgur.com/puRNrux.jpg)
